title: Pyke's VO is one of the most bare-bones and disappointing in recent memory.
body:
It's only rivaled by, perhaps ironically, the champion released just prior to him, Kai'sa. 

Pyke has very few interactions, not even with champions you'd think would be a no-brainer. No Nautilus interactions? Really?

And the actual lines and delivery of said lines is very... average. His teaser video played him up as a terrifying pirate revenant, but he's apparently just a generically growly pirate. He's sarcastic, jokey, and thuggish as if he was some normal pirate dude instead of the revenge-seeking spirit he is. 

His release isn't as boring as Kai'sa's was, but it is interesting that, after quite a while of a largely unbroken string of solid champion releases from a VO, art, and character perspective, Riot has dropped the ball so badly with the latest two new champ releases. Here's hoping the third one won't be as poorly-handled.

replies.body: Hey! Just to give some clarity here. I cut most of Pyke's VO interactions for a number of reasons. First: they rarely fire in-game. We've been trying to focus our scripts down more to be tighter. Pyke himself doesn't acknowledge a lot of other characters because he does not care who they really are, they're either on his list or going to be on his list. He doesn't care about their bio, their family, their backstory or their personality. They are names to be crossed off a list.

just wanna put my 2 cents in, pls dont "tighten" up character VO's, t might seem practical now, but those voice lines are basically with the champ for life except for rework of the odd opportunistic replacement like Maokai. 

While the lore is great (I love it I really do) its pretty isolationist for the most part, aside from the big shabangs like the bilgewater event the stories mostly resolve around a single character doing a thing in their environment. The VO of the champs and their interactions/comments with each other were one of the few places lore shone consistently, so to hear Riot is trying to reel it in is a little sad. 

Not to say they all have to be super talkative (Rek Sai sounds cool as heck and if Rammus ever gets 50 voice lines you did something wrong) but in general more is better, even if they almost never play in game you know day 1 I watch the new/upadated champ's voice lines, cause I love it and want more, not less of it.

Now putting my feelings on that aside, what I feel about THIS champ in particular is that you say he doesn't care about others, and the VO does a really good job of showing him as the paranoid, distrustful, revenge killer he is. But than you have this duality of him also being a support that works with others, you have some lines it there like when he gets kill 1v1 "I needed a crew" or some such, and then you have some allied taunts about how their on the bottom of the list. But to me the best lines are when hes sharing the kill gold. I wish you put more emphasis on it, he made it sound like business but I imagine working with anyone in his state is a big deal.  

(you can ignore this paragraph if you want cause now its just me inserting stuff between the lines) This is where my head canon comes in to fix it, I say to myself "Pyke's hurt, and he's angry but he still wants to trust SOMEBODY." and just as everykill drowns him deeper, I think he finds breath with every helping hand.

Thanks for the champ and don't let up on the VO in future please

Id have liked to see more "automatic" interactions (attacking and killing enemies, or the lines on urgots ult) and maybe just give up on champion specific taunt lines as those really do never get played
